ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 111 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 111 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would recommend the course, more for the experience than for the material taught. Prof. Bloom has many interesting anecdotes and stories to tell, and during discussions, he spots the soundness and merit in every comment. A less intimidating course than one might expect.
Take this if you can. Professor Bloom is a lovely human being, and a complete genius. Reading Shakespeare's masterpieces with Harold Bloom-- what's not to love?
ABSOLUTELY YES YES YES IF YOU GET IN TAKE THIS CLASS. It is an experience unlike anything else you will find... anywhere.
Classes like this are why you go to Yale.

Not at all a typical course, but a fantastic opportunity to do some "big" thinking. This class is the kind of experience you will only have at this school, with this professor. Completely and utterly worth it. A year I will never forget.
I would recommend this course--and have done so. It is marvelous.
